title: Improve Error Output for In Parentheses

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When using closures when used with other arguments, a missing comma can lead to fairly verbose and non-descriptive error output. Given the following [code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=80ae9a22520368b1f01b66541d6a87cd):

# Closure as Parameter

```rust
pub fn main() {
    let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0425]: cannot find value `x` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:2:17
  |
2 |     let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
  |                 ^ not found in this scope

error[E0425]: cannot find value `y` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:2:20
  |
2 |     let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
  |                    ^ not found in this scope

error[E0425]: cannot find value `x` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:2:23
  |
2 |     let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
  |                       ^ not found in this scope

error[E0425]: cannot find value `y` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:2:27
  |
2 |     let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
  |                           ^ not found in this scope

error: aborting due to 4 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[EXXXX]: invalid closure after expression
 --> src/main.rs:3:30
  |
3 |     let _ = (1 |x, y| x + y);
  |                   ^ help: missing comma before closure
```

# Simpler Example

The output of a simpler [example](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2b00741684f09672d82db800f657514b) is much more descriptive, and produces less noise:

```rust
pub fn main() {
    let _ = 1 |x, y| x + y;
}
```

```
error: expected one of `!`, `.`, `::`, `;`, `?`, `{`, or an operator, found `,`
 --> main.rs:2:17
  |
2 |     let _ = 1 |x, y| x + y;
  |                 ^ expected one of 7 possible tokens

error: aborting due to previous error
```

Ideally, the error output should be either of the two outputs. Both error outputs are identical in stable and nightly.
